skill.name: writing-docs
skill.description: Expert at writing high-quality documentation for code, APIs, and projects. Auto-invokes when generating docstrings, creating README files, writing API documentation, adding code comments, or producing any technical documentation. Provides language-specific templates and best practices for effective documentation writing.

skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, no network activity, and appropriate tool permissions for file-based documentation work.

content.value_statement: Writing clear documentation takes time away from coding. This skill provides language-specific templates and best practices for creating professional docstrings, README files, and API documentation automatically.
actual_capabilities: Generates JSDoc and TypeScript documentation templates
Writes Go and Rust documentation comments
Builds professional README files with all sections
Documents function parameters with types and examples
limitations: Does not execute code to verify examples work
Does not generate documentation for binary or compiled files
Requires user to review and customize templates for their specific needs
Does not translate documentation to other languages

use_cases.title: Document functions fast
use_cases.description: Generate consistent docstrings for JavaScript, Python, Go, and Rust codebases

use_cases.title: Create project READMEs
use_cases.description: Build comprehensive README files with installation, usage, and API sections

use_cases.title: Write API documentation
use_cases.description: Produce clear API reference docs with parameters, return types, and examples

prompt_templates.title: Document a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Document this function with proper docstrings: [paste function code]

prompt_templates.title: Create README
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a README file for my project: [describe project purpose and features]

prompt_templates.title: Document API endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Write API documentation for this endpoint: [paste endpoint code with parameters]

prompt_templates.title: Document class
prompt_templates.prompt: Document this class with full documentation: [paste class code]

output_examples.input: Document this function: function add(a, b) { return a + b; }
output: - a (number): The first number to add
- b (number): The second number to add
Returns: (number) The sum of a and b

best_practices: Always include a brief one-line summary as the first line
Document all parameters with types and default values
Add working code examples that users can copy and use
Include error conditions and exceptions that may be thrown
anti_patterns: Using vague descriptions like 'Process data' without specifics
Omitting parameter types or return value documentation
Writing documentation that duplicates code without adding context
Including outdated or untested code examples

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, and Rust with language-specific documentation formats.

faq.question: Does this skill verify that examples work?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates templates and examples. Always test documentation examples in your environment.

faq.question: Can it integrate with documentation generators?
faq.answer: The skill produces compatible templates. Integration depends on your specific documentation build tools.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only processes code you explicitly provide. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my generated docs missing information?
faq.answer: Provide more context about parameters, return values, and edge cases. The skill needs this information to generate complete docs.

faq.question: How is this different from auto-document generators?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on writing clear, human-readable documentation following best practices, not just extracting types.
